markdownRemark.html:
Score: 92.5

news-gazette.com  (WEB - en-US)

The combined website of The News-Gazette, a daily newspaper, and CBS-affiliated radio station NewsTalk 1400 WDWS-AM, both of which are based in Champaign, Illinois.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The News-Gazette and WDWS are owned by a local media group, News-Gazette Media, that in turn is owned by the Marajen Stevick Foundation, a Champaign-based nonprofit. News-Gazette.com earns revenue through advertising and subscriptions.

Content

The site runs content from the News-Gazette and WDWS, including coverage of politics, government, business, arts, entertainment, and sports in the Champaign-Urbana metropolitan area and surrounding communities in East Central Illinois. Both outlets extensively cover University of Illinois athletics. The site also publishes videos and photo galleries.

Journalists from the two outlets produce most local content on the site, while state, national, and international content is provided by The Associated Press.

The site hosts more than 20 podcasts produced by News-Gazette and WDWS journalists, mostly focused on local news and sports. The site also runs syndicated radio programs, including shows produced by CBS News.

Credibility

News-Gazette.com reporting is balanced and fact-based, often citing first-hand interviews, official documents, and other credible sources. Headlines reflect the content of articles.

Opinionated content, including op-eds, editorials, and letters to the editor, is clearly labeled and published in a dedicated section. The paper’s editorial pages have traditionally reflected a conservative perspective, according to News-Gazette.com, but, the site states, “other voices and other views are constantly sought [...] through columnists, guest commentaries and letters to the editor.”

The site runs corrections, in the form on an editor’s note at the top or bottom of stories, with an explanation of what was corrected.

Transparency

Articles on News-Gazette.com name the author and link to an archive of the writer’s work. A staff page lists the names, phone numbers, email addresses, and social media handles of News-Gazette staff, including newspaper leadership. A Contact Us page lists a general contact form and phone number. Biographical information for WDWS’ local on-air staff is available on a separate page.

The News-Gazette’s ownership by the Marajen Stevick Foundation, through News-Gazette Media, is not clearly disclosed on News-Gazette.com. The Marajen Stevick Foundation is mentioned on a history page buried in the site’s help section, and the site’s copyright at the bottom of each page lists News-Gazette Media’s registered name, The News-Gazette Inc. NewsGuard does not consider this to be adequate disclosure of ownership.

Asked about the site’s ownership disclosure, News-Gazette Editor Jeff D'Alessio told NewsGuard in an email: “News-Gazette Media is a brand that was recently created. It's been written about fairly extensively and prominently, including a column by our publisher.”

Advertisements are clearly distinguished from news coverage.

History

The News-Gazette was formed in 1919 when David W. Stevick, owner of The Champaign Daily News, purchased his paper’s competitor, the Champaign Daily Gazette, and merged the two publications. He founded WDWS in 1937.

Stevick’s wife, Helen, became the paper’s president and publisher after he died in 1935. Their daughter, Marajen Chinigo, took over after Helen Stevick died in 1967 and led the paper until her own death in 2002. At that time, ownership was transferred to The Marajen Stevick Foundation, established by the family to help assure the operation’s viability.

News-Gazette.com was registered as a domain in 1996.

Written by:
Sophia Tewa

Edited by:
Melissa Goldin Eric Effron
